isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Cylinder Head and Valves - Clean, Inspect, and Test - Cylinder Head

step1.para: Remove lifting eyes and lifting eye mounting hardware from cylinder head.
Insert valve in cylinder head to protect seats.

Remove deposits and gasket material from gasket surface of cylinder head. Use Rotary Wire Brush or Sanding Block with Mineral Spirits
.
Clean all block bolt holes, clean cylinder head bolt threads in block. Use appropriate brush from Cleaning Brush Set (ZTSE4320) and appropriate bottoming tap from Critical Metric Taps (ZTSE4386) .
Clear debris from bolt holes, oil return and water passages, using filtered compressed air.
Wash all bolts and washers with a suitable solvent and dry thoroughly.

note.para: Dirt in threads or damaged threads may cause binding and result in a false torque measurement.

step1.para: Test all head bolts, replace bolts that fail. Use Cylinder Head Bolt Gage (ZTSE4481) .
Remove valves from cylinder head.

svcsubproc.title: Measure for Warping
svcsubproc.para: Measure cylinder head gasket surface for warping. Use Bevelled Edge Straightedge (OEM1293) and Feeler Gauge , follow warp pattern shown. See " Specifications ," if measurements are not in specification cylinder head must be resurfaced or replaced. Measure cylinder head deck thickness before resurfacing, see "Measure Cylinder Head Deck Thickness" in this section. Minimum deck-to-deck dimension must be maintained during resurfacing.

svcsubproc.title: Measure Cylinder Head Deck Thickness
svcsubproc.para: Measure cylinder head deck thickness at six locations, four corners and two center points. Use Outside Micrometer . See cylinder head specifications in " Specifications ." If minimum deck-to-deck dimension (after rework) cannot be maintained, replace cylinder head.

step1.para:
Spray cleaner on lower deck (gasket surface) of cylinder head and wipe dry. Use Defect Detector Kit (Dye Penetrant) (OEM1272)
and Clean Dry Cloth.
Spray dye penetrant on lower deck surface. Allow dye to remain on surface for one to ten minutes.
Lightly wipe dye penetrant off lower deck surface.

note.para: Dye will remain in any cracks during "wipe off" step.

step1.para: Spray developer on and let dry for five to 15 minutes. Inspect lower deck surface for cracks. Cracks will show as purple lines against white developer.

caution.para: To avoid vehicle damage, cylinder head must be replaced, if any cracks are found.

svcsubproc.title: Pressure Test Cylinder Head
svcsubproc.para: Pressure test of cylinder head will reveal cracks in ports or sleeve leakage which cannot be observed using dye penetrant.

step1.para: If removed, install fuel injector shoulder bolts in cylinder head. Tighten shoulder bolts to " Special Torque ."
Install fuel injectors in cylinder head injector bores. See "Fuel Injector Installation" in this section.
Remove valves. See "Cylinder Head Reconditioning", later in this section.
Install Head Pressure Test Kit (ZTSE4289A) . Attach pressure plate and gasket from the kit on cylinder head gasket surface with 24 mounting bolts and nuts also from kit.

Remove thermostat. Attach Thermostat Opening Pressure Test Adapter (ZTSE4647)
and Water Supply Housing Pressure Test Adapter (ZTSE4648)
to cylinder head with existing fasteners.

figure.caption: Fasten pressure plate to cylinder head

step1.para: Fill cylinder head with hot water.
Install air regulator on the thermostat test adapter.

calloutgroup.callout1: Air regulator in Thermostat Opening Pressure Test Adapter (ZTSE4647)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields when using compressed air for cleaning or testing to reduce the danger from flying debris. Limit the air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Attach a hose fitting to the air regulator. Apply 124 to 138 kPa (18 to 20 psi) and inspect for leaks at the following locations:

note.para: If leakage is observed at any port or upper and lower deck, cylinder head must be replaced.
